title: Does a country gain anything when its universities provide full scholarship to international students? - Quora
tags: College and University Scholarship and Fellowships Advice
College and University Scholarship and Fellowships

response.answer_text: They gain a certain amount of good will that is spread when the student returns to the home country and shares insights. That can help dispel stereotypes from television and other sources. I believe this is why the State Department sponsors EducationUSA through US Embassies around the world. EducationUSA has a website with information about studying in the US, and sponsors advising centers around the world. EducationUSA

A country might gain educated immigrants. For diverse countries taking the best and brightest from other countries where many desire to stay where they get the education can be beneficial. So countries with great universities might gain something by accepting international students who excel. Other students may take the education and go back home. Education is generally good, but countries may limit certain education for national security reasons.
The only gain would be if the full scholarships were provided to only the best and brightest students, who would contribute to the discussion and raise the standards of the university.
